Reviews.Title: “Good location and facilities for a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: MuhdAtif
Reviews.Content: The hotel has all the basic amenities you expect from a budget hotel .The location is close to major historical attractions .So i must say it is not bad value for money.However at night they was noise coming from the wall .I complained to the reception but i was told by receptionist that all the hotels nearby have those noises and nothing can be done about it.Although the noise might not be in all rooms but i will advise to carry earplugs along as you might need them .The hotel has a nice breakfast buffet of pepperoni,eggs ,olives cheese ,bread,cereals ,yogurt.orange. cherry juice and coffee.One downside of staying in the hotel is that there were not many people in breakfast room to socialise with.i had a friend staying at agora hostel nearby which had a very crowded breakfast room every morning full of travellers especially students that one could socialise with but my hotel's breakfast room used to be empty mostly.

Reviews.Title: “quiet, cozy but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: luxhill
Reviews.Content: Nice, quiet location with a killer step to get into the lobby. As normal a really nice desk clerk. Nice breakfast on the roof. I have only stayed in two Istanbul hotels but compared to our terrible experience with the Antik Ipek/Malabadi scam, this was heaven on earth. The beds were small and some what uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “i am amazed”
Reviews.Author: Marit H
Reviews.Content: wow..really..i am working as a travel-agent, and i see hundreds of different hotels in a year..this trip was not business , but for my own interests in Istanbul..and for that Kaftan hotel is perfectly situated..all historical places i needed to visit..were just to close to be true...hotel size is just perfect if you usually work with people..not too big what makes it very cozy and comfortable..rooms size is normal..i managed to fit in with my big bag, cause usually i don't..always very well cleaned..and nice white slippers :))..had a very nice view..boats, boats, boats during the day..and beatiful citylights at night...service..well..people were very kind..if i was dead tired of walking around, organized dinner for me and also without no problem a bus back to airport..although as the hotel has a very good location , it is really easy to get to the hotel and then get back to the airportl on your own..really, people in the hotell were really nice and helpful..and that smiling lady in the breakfastroom..always made sure you eat enough and you are happy with your food..i still miss her :)..really if you wanna make a small citybreak, where hotel should be well located and not too many other tourists..this is IT..price and accomondation is balanced..as i like Istanbul..i am sure i will return..and of course back to Kaftan :) my thumbs are up..breakfastroom..also has a nice view :)

Reviews.Title: “Close to tourist attractions, but also to train :(”
Reviews.Author: Jmecherutza
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very good location, quite neighbourhood with terraces and restaurant and - reaching - as they say in the presentation - the Blue Mosque in ~2 min, Hagia Sophia in 3. Also the rooms were nice and the personnel quite ok. the only problem was the the rooms in the front were smaller and no view, but in the rooms in the back you had to deal with the train passing at ~ 30 metres. We got used to it thanks to year plugs (which I recommend for everybody in Istanbul unless you want to wake for the morning prayer :)). Overall the hotel was ok, but if I return I wil look for something with a better view and no train around :)

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: Greying
Reviews.Content: I'm torn between an "average" and a "very good" rating. This hotel definitely had flaws. Some issues with the wireless the first night (but excited to have wireless at a hotel so reasonably priced), electricity went out once, and hot water was missing one water. But as we reported each problem, it was addressed. I liked the front desk staff, for the most part, but they were disorganized and we had to have a small argument re/ a charge that I had paid for, but they hadn't recorded (they deferred to me in the end). Still......it met our needs and had a convenient location. I think the best part was the lovely breakfast area with a great view; it was a wonderful way to start each day. The room was clean and quiet (and small), and I slept well. So it met my needs and I'd probably consider returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and....that's it”
Reviews.Author: bishikawa
Reviews.Content: We booked the Kaftan hotel based on price and location. The location, an easy walk from the major sites, yet on a very quiet side street, was superb. We stayed 5 nights. The hotel itself is adequate at best. The guys who run the place are nice, helpful enough, but always seemed exhausted and low on energy. The rooms are small, that's okay, but stuff didn't work. Our "double" bed was two singles side by side made up with one set of sheets. SIngle size sheet and blanket, not adequate. There was no hot water one day, they went down the basement and flipped a switch I guess, but we lost 20 precious vacation minutes waiting for the water to heat up before we could take showers. The air conditioner is on some central energy saving system, it would run for 2 minutes, then be off for 4, then on for 2, etc. The room never got cool until our third or fourth complaint, then it blasted and we froze on our last night. The cleaning was mediocre. We were in a ground floor room our first night, the guy apologized even before we complained and promised to move us when another opened up the next day. I looked in the shower and thought "what a great idea - black caulk so you can't tell if it's dirty." Closer inspection revealed that it was black with crud. Breakfast was a typical Turkish breakfast, cold buffet of yogurt, cheeses, olives, some scary looking meat, cereal, canned juices and tea. There is free WiFi and an available computer in the lobby (an iMac running Windows). The best thing about this hotel is it is in Istanbul, a great city that keeps you away from your room most of the time. There are many hotels on the same quiet street. We'll try a different one next time.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: euskera
Reviews.Content: We decided to book this hotel because it was well located and the reviews weren't bad. We knew that it wouldn't be luxurious but the reviews said that it would be compensated by the kindness and attention of the staff. We stayed at the hotel 4 nigths and it wasn't as good as expected. The tiny room was clean but the lavatory was sinking from our arrival and they even try to move us to another room, they just put towels every morning. The breakfast was short and it was served in what they called "a terrace" that obviously wasn't. When we booked the hotel the website said that for a stay of 4 nigths you could get a free transport from the airport and they made us pay for it the day after aour arrival, and it was expensive, 30 euro! The staff barely spoke English although they tried to help with the activities. It is a three store hotel without lif, so keep it in mind before arriving with heavy luggage.

Reviews.Title: “went beyond the average hotel”
Reviews.Author: krazeeknuk
Reviews.Content: situated close to all atractions. Able to speak english. Most helpful and accomodating. excellent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Spent 2 nights at this great little...”
Reviews.Author: Zakira5
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at this great little hotel. If you're on a budget and looking for something comfortable and in a good location then this is the hotel you want. Located in Sultanahmet we were 5 minutes walk to the Blue Mosque and 15 minutes walk from the Grand Bizarre. The staff at Kaftan were amazing and really accommodating with all requests. Would definitely come back to this one when next in Istanbul!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cosy practical hotel in picturesque street with smiles all round!!”
Reviews.Author: TDriessen
Reviews.Content: Our group of 9 (young) adults was brilliantly accommodated in this small but complete Hotel in the old part of Istanbul. The first thing that strikes you upon arrival is the big smile and friendly approach by the receptionist Ecevit. His priceless sightseeing advice in well spoken English was well appreciated by our group and the humour in his explanations was never far away. Walking distance from some of the greatest attractions and plenty of restaurants in the vicinity. The rooms were decent and clean, the breakfast is plentiful and taken from the rooftop with view over the Bosphorus and old town.

Reviews.Title: “no parking”
Reviews.Author: VDaniel
Reviews.Content: Hello, I just would like to say that the hotel is clean, pretty close to the major atractions, rooms are very small and it doesn't have parking. The "parking"spot is right in front of the hotel on a very narrow street, on which my car was hit a few times. After this they recommended a real parking close by, at 5 eur/day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: WilliamLondonUK
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel for location and price/quality is good.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: johnloughor
Reviews.Content: The hotel was small as were the rooms, BUT the location was amazing. There were Hotels nearby which cost 3 or 4 times the cost of the Kaftan. Staff were friendly and helpful, without being gushing. On the downside, you are so close to the Blue Mosque that you will hear the call to prayer at 5am. The smell of cats pee is something you need to get used to. I didnt find that a problem, however. I would certainly book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible loaction with a friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: iliah
Reviews.Content: Small and cozy hotel in the best location near historical sights. Five minutes walking distance to everything you will need. Perfect breakfast overlooking an incredible view. Rooms are small yet very comfortable, enough to bring four pieces of luggage with you. Air conditioning is very quiet and powerful, the showers were very clean and worked brand new. I do not have any bad things to say about the hotel and have nothing to complain about. Hotels that we saw and wwanted to book instead of this one, ended up being stepss away from our hotel. The hotels were exactly the same in every way, with maybe a nicer foyer but cost twice as much. Most of all i would like to bring attention to Murat and his coworker at the reception desk, did a fantastic job helping us enjoy the most of our time and being so very kind adn helpful. Over all i would rate this hotel 5 stars out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “OK if your first few choices are full”
Reviews.Author: Ottawa_25
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night after booking through a travel agency. The desk staff was friendly and the room was clean. However, the room was tiny, (the bathroom felt practically on top of the bed and the bed filled the whole room with very little space to walk around the bed or put a bag down. The room looked out toward train tracks, as did the breakfast room. We were surprised that the list price of our room was 120 Euros (we paid for a package through a travel agency so did not pay directly), but it did not seems worth it. Particularly in an area saturated with hotels, it seems that a more spacious room with a better view could be found for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that gains a lot from its location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Vamar1
Reviews.Content: Location and very helpful staff. When I sent the hotel an e-mail asking how to get to the hotel, the reception manager responded immediately describing all options of getting there, including metro/tram. In terms of location, it is just a few minutes walk from the Blue Mosque, tram and train station (if you carry heavy luggage you'd be better off taking a taxi/shuttle arranged by the hotel). Excellent sea view from the upper floor breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cozy hotel in the historic center”
Reviews.Author: taksofan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights while having short sightseeing trip to Istanbul. Liked: - great location: near Blue Mosque and St. Sophia - amazingly helpful staff - good windows that allowed us to sleep in the morning despite of nearby mosques - good renovated room and especially bathroom - free high-speed wi-fi Disliked: - room wasn't cleaned during our stay, bad linen and towels never changed - sometimes only cold water was in the shower - very, very small room: our double room was only 2.5x2.5 metres. But ok if you only sleep in the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Please do avoid ! VÃ¤lttÃ¤kÃ¤Ã¤ !”
Reviews.Author: Donjohnsson
Reviews.Content: There's a railway going 30 meters behind the hotels, rooms and doors are paper so you can hear everything, peoples climbing bethween the floor, employees talking on reception etc.. Rooms are dirty. We had old bodyhairs all over the bathroom and floor. Beds are from the 18th cenruty. Theres ne sleeping matress, only the bed and its springs are broken. I saw tree rooms and all was totally same condition. Maximum 2 star hotel !! Theres no safetybox but you can give passports to reception safety. Brekfast is ok. Same tomatoes and cucumbers were there 3 days in row. All the previous comments "its lovely hotels" must be the hotel owner's so just skip them. Positive sides are good location, free internet and wlan network, Tv channel inclubinf bbc, cnn, al jazeera etc... and most important extremely helpful staff. They were great, but i think this is maximum 50 euros hotel per night.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel to avoid - a terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: carnivore110
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel I would definitely not advise anyone to stay at, particularly those with children. We were exhausted when we arrived at the Kaftan having started our journey early in the morning. The manager at reception did not make us feel at all welcome and seemed to take a dislike to our children instantly. We were shown to a depressing room on the ground floor with views looking into a neighbouring residential properly and overlooking a staff corridor. The manager then explained that he had other rooms available but would not be offering them to us as our children were too noisy. He said this in a very personal and condescending manner and made comparisons between our children and his own. This was all within the first 10 min or reaching the hotel. We could not understand this reaction as we have travelled frequently with our children and never had this sort of experience. The remarks were quite personal and uncalled for even if our children had been noisy which was not the case (2 boys ages 3 and 8 months). This was a hotel we were clearly not welcome at and promptly left. We eventually managed to get a room at the Tashkonak where my family and I had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Save money, enjoy Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Ksenia_Moscow
Reviews.Content: Small, but comfortable. Although the rooms are not that spacious as you may expect, you have everything you need there: new bathroom amenities, clean towels, soft slippers, big enough beds and everyday cleaning. Location is great, it will take you no more than five minutes to get either to Blue Mosque and St. Sofia or to the seafront to enjoy the view. Btw, you may as well enjoy the view from the hotel resto at breakfast. The staff is friendly and helpfull, so you will start feeling traditional turkish hospitality right here. PC, Internet - always available in the lobby. Do not forget to play with the local cat, she (or he?) is a cutie.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly”
Reviews.Author: lhc-ts
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very small but very clean; the position of the hotel is very central; the proximity of the railway line is not disturbing; the staff are very friendly and very, very helpful. Highly recommended for a budget visit.

Reviews.Title: “Greate place to stay !”
Reviews.Author: mikoalex
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Kaftan Hotel for 6 nights. I recommend this hotel because of the location (right in the city center) and first of all - very kind and helpful staff. The room was clean, the breakfast tasty. I have a good remembrance of Kaftan Hotel and I recommend to visit it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money. Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: ruicarv
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Kaftan hotel for 3 nights and I must say that everything went just fine. Great breakfast with view to the Marmara sea. It is an above average hotel for the turkish standard (which is not always very good), although the room we got was very small (but clean!). I recommend it. Great value for money. Excellent location (very next to all main highlights of Istanbul like Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia, etc...)!

Reviews.Title: “Very plesant stay with great service”
Reviews.Author: dlarry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kaftan Hotel for 4 night. I highly receommend the hotel. It is located right in the city-center and pretty close to all main-attractions of Istanbul. The staffmembers were absolutely helpful and gave useful advices about plannings etc. Also the breakfast was ok. We enjoyed the nice view from the roofterrace above the Marmara-Sea!!! All in all, the Kaftan is a very nice place to start your Istanbul trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Kaftan - my Istanbul home”
Reviews.Author: Gemmbird
Reviews.Content: I just can't even think about another hotel when i visit Istanbul. Kaftan is the hotel where I'm sure that the staff will help me anytime I need. I was afraid when I came in Istanbul for the first time alone, and Kaftan owner told me if I'll have some problems in town to call him on mobile immediately. I was never refused for anything and always treated as a queen! I like everything at this hotel and next time I'll stay here for sure, it's my Istanbul home indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Kaftan Hotel - the best choice”
Reviews.Author: KelliTallinn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Kaftan hotel with my friend while visiting Istanbul in the beginning of September. The location is really as it says - just a few steps from major sightseeing sites and at the same time in a quiet street. The rooms are small but clean and cozy and you feel really like coming home after an exhausting day in this magnificent city. During the breakfast which is really tasty, you can look at the Bosphorus and make your plans for the day. I have really travelled a lot - I used to be a tour-guide for cultural trips in Europe-and seen a lot of hotels and their staff - belive me the Kaftan is very good! If you come by plane at night, like I did, donÂ´t hesitate to take their transfer. The price is fair and you donÂ´t have to look for the hotel. IÂ´d ,also, recommend to ask the hotel staff who is very-very friendly and they all speak English (and perhaps other languages, too) about the historical SÃ¼lemanye hammam - it was really enjoyable.If you donÂ´t expect anything super fancy the Kaftan is really great. My hint - listen to the staff - their suggestions are wise! I am surely going to Istanbul once again and IÂ´m planning to stay at the Kaftan!

Reviews.Title: “everthing was perfect”
Reviews.Author: Adambh
Reviews.Content: Perfect staff, location, very good price and clean hotel. Staff was very friendly a very willing, beause of them we have a good remembrance of Kaftan hotel a Istanbul. We recomend to visit. Amjad Bani Hani

HotelInfo.Name: Kaftan Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Mimarmehmetaga Caddesi, Amiral Tafdil Sok No:45, Istanbul 34410, Turkey
